Uses of Class
xxl.core.cursors.SecureDecoratorCursor

Packages that use SecureDecoratorCursor
xxl.core.cursors The package xxl.core.cursors provides a whole algebra of cursors that extends the functionality of the classes Iterator and Enumeration. 
xxl.core.cursors.filters The package xxl.core.cursors.filters provides miscellaneous implementations of filter operators on cursors. 
xxl.core.cursors.identities The package xxl.core.cursors.identities provides miscellaneous implementations of identity operators on cursors. 
xxl.core.cursors.sorters The package xxl.core.cursors.sorters provides miscellaneous implementations of sort operators on cursors. 
xxl.core.relational.cursors The package provides a whole algebra of cursors that extends the functionality of the classes cursors. 
xxl.core.spatial.geometries.cursors A collection of spatial queries. 
 

Uses of SecureDecoratorCursor in xxl.core.cursors
 

Subclasses of SecureDecoratorCursor in xxl.core.cursors
 class AbstractMetaDataCursor<E,M>
          This class decorates an object implementing the interface Cursor such that it is able to provide metadata information.
 class Subquery<E>
          This class is a prototypical implementation for subqueries which may be used in exist, all, any predicates, etc.
 

Uses of SecureDecoratorCursor in xxl.core.cursors.filters
 

Subclasses of SecureDecoratorCursor in xxl.core.cursors.filters
 class Dropper<E>
          A dropper drops a user defined number of the given iterator's elements.
 class Filter<E>
          A filter is a decorator-cursor that selects the iteration's elements with the help of a user defined predicate (or boolean function for backward compatibility).
 class Remover<E>
          The remover removes all elements of a given input iteration in a lazy way, i.e., the remove method is called for all elements of the input iterator that are returned by a call to the next method.
 class Sampler<E>
          A sampler is a filter that generates a sample of the elements contained in a given input iteration.
 class Taker<E>
          A taker is a decorator-cursor that returns the next number elements of a given iteration.
 class WhileDropper<E>
          A while-dropper swallows the elements of an input iteration as long as an unary predicate (or boolean function) is equal to a user defined flag.
 class WhileRemover<E>
          A while-remover removes the elements of an input cursor with the help of a user defined predicate (or boolean function).
 class WhileTaker<E>
          A while-taker returns the elements of an input iteration as long as an unary predicate (or boolean function) evaluated on each input element equals to a user defined flag.
 

Uses of SecureDecoratorCursor in xxl.core.cursors.identities
 

Subclasses of SecureDecoratorCursor in xxl.core.cursors.identities
 class DelayCursor
          This class holds the values of the underlying input iteration for a certain amount of time before returning the object.
 class UnmodifiableCursor<E>
          This class provides a decorator for a given iteration that cannot be modified.
 

Uses of SecureDecoratorCursor in xxl.core.cursors.sorters
 

Subclasses of SecureDecoratorCursor in xxl.core.cursors.sorters
 class ShuffleCursor<E>
          A shuffle-cursor is a decorator-cursor, that permutes the input iteration's elements randomly.
 

Uses of SecureDecoratorCursor in xxl.core.relational.cursors
 

Subclasses of SecureDecoratorCursor in xxl.core.relational.cursors
 class Projection
          Straight forward implementation of the operator projection.
 class Renaming
          Straight forward implementation of the operator renaming.
 class Selection
          Straight forward implementation of the operator selection.
 

Uses of SecureDecoratorCursor in xxl.core.spatial.geometries.cursors
 

Subclasses of SecureDecoratorCursor in xxl.core.spatial.geometries.cursors
 class DistanceQuery
          A DistanceQuery delivers all neighbors of a query-object whose distance to the query- object is below epsilon.
 class KNearestNeighborQuery
          Performs a K-Nearest-Neighbor-Query by returning the results of a Nearest-Neighbor-Operator until the number of demanded elements is reached, or no further elements can be delivered.
 class PointQuery
          A Point query returns all the indexed geometries which contain a specified point It can be realised as a special form of the window- query where the query- object is a point an the refinement predicate is 'within'.
 class RegionQuery
          A region query returns those geometries which lie inside the given query- object or which intersect its edge.
 class SpatialJoin<F,R>
          An abstract multi-step Spatial Join: the join takes an input cursor of possible join- candidates identified by a filterstep and returns those candidates which satisfy the given refinement predicate.
